description: LCM {prime(i)-1, i=1..n}, where prime() are the primes.
comments: A002110(n) divides b^(a(n)+1) - b, where b is an arbitrary integer. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Nov 24 2014What is the asymptotic growth of this sequence? a(n) <= A005867(n) <= A002110(n) < e^((1 + o(1))n log n) but this is a large overestimate. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 03 2014
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
prog: (Haskell)a058254 n = a058254_list !! (n-1)a058254_list = scanl1 lcm a006093_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 01 2013(PARI) a(n)=lcm(apply(p->p-1, primes(n))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 03 2014
author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 06 2000
